faq.title: I'm getting 'Invalid Object Name KeyGen' exception

faq-answers.faq: Sooda needs a way to generate primary keys for objects long before they are committed to the database. There's a special table that manages the keys. It's called KeyGen and the declaration is: create table dbo.KeyGen ( key_name varchar(64) primary key not null, key_value int not null ) go After you create this table and grant the database user the correct permissions, your problems should be gone.

faq.title: I'm getting 'ObjectsAssembly has not been set for this SoodaTransaction.' exception. What should I do?

faq-answers.faq: You're getting this exception because you've not told Sooda where to look for the assembly that contains objects factories. See here for an explanation.
